name: Pushme.js
tagline: Push elements into specific containers depended on certain media queries.
body:
###What is it? This small but might really useful [jQuery](http://www.jquery.com) Plugin makes possible to push elements into specific containers depended on certain media queries. Possible use cases: * Bring spread elements together to display them inside offcanvas * Rearrange elements for better usability and reading on smaller devices * Trick the natural behavior for order and wrap to avoid from doing thaumaturgic CSS feats * And many others... ###Demo Check out a short example of the pushme.js:
http://jsfiddle.net/v9tWd/3/ ###Installation Just include the `pushme.js` and initialize it for your elements. Note: Also make sure that jQuery is defined. ``` ``` ``` $(window).on('resize', function() { $('.foo').pushme({ element: '.bar', pushAction: 'prependTo', mq: 'screen and (max-width:767px)' }); }); ``` *
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
